And when the multitude were put foorth, hee went in and tooke her by And this bruite went throughout all that lande. And as Iesus departed thence, two blinde men followed him, crying, and And when hee was come into the house, the blinde came to him, and Then touched he their eyes, saying, According to your faith be it vnto And their eyes were opened, and Iesus gaue them great charge, saying, But when they were departed, they spread abroad his fame throughout And as they went out, beholde, they brought to him a domme man And when the deuill was cast out, the domme spake: then the multitude But the Pharises saide, He casteth out deuils, through the prince of And Iesus went about all cities and townes, teaching in their But when he saw the multitude, he had compassion vpon them, because Then saide he to his disciples, Surely the haruest is great, but the Wherefore pray the Lord of the haruest, that he woulde sende foorth

And hee called his twelue disciples vnto him, and gaue them power Nowe the names of the twelue Apostles are these. The first is Simon, Philippe and Bartlemewe: Thomas, and Matthewe that Publicane: Iames Simon the Cananite, and Iudas Iscariot, who also betraied him. These twelue did Iesus send forth, and commanded them, saying, Goe not But goe rather to the lost sheepe of the house of Israel. And as ye goe, preach, saying, The kingdome of heauen is at hand. Heale the sicke: cleanse the lepers: raise vp the dead: cast out the deuils. Possesse not golde, nor siluer, nor money in your girdels, Nor a scrippe for the iourney, neither two coates, neither shoes, nor a And into whatsoeuer citie or towne ye shall come, enquire who is worthy And when yee come into an house, salute the same. And if the house be worthy, let your peace come vpon it: but if it be not And whosoeuer shall not receiue you, nor heare your woordes, when yee Truely I say vnto you, it shall be easier for them of the lande of Sodom Behold, I send you as sheepe in the middes of the wolues: be yee But beware of men, for they will deliuer you vp to the Councils, and will And ye shall be brought to the gouernours and Kings for my sake, in But when they deliuer you vp, take no thought howe or what ye shall For it is not yee that speake, but the spirite of your father which speaketh And the brother shall betray the brother to death, and the father the And yee shall be hated of all men for my Name: but he that endureth to And when they persecute you in this citie, flee into another: for verely I The disciple is not aboue his master, nor the seruant aboue his Lord. It is ynough for the disciple to bee as his master is, and the seruaunt as Feare them not therefore: for there is nothing couered, that shall not be What I tell you in darkenesse, that speake yee in light: and what yee And feare yee not them which kill the bodie, but are nor able to kill the Are not two sparrowes sold for a farthing, and one of them shall not fal Yea, and all the heares of your head are nombred. Feare ye not therefore, yee are of more value then many sparowes. Whosoeuer therefore shall confesse me before men, him will I confesse But whosoeuer shall denie me before me, him will I also denie before Thinke not that I am come to sende peace into the earth: I came not to For I am come to set a man at variance against his father, and the And a mans enemies shall be they of his owne housholde. He that loueth father or mother more then me, is not worthie of me. And And hee that taketh not his crosse, and followeth after me, is not worthie He that will finde his life, shall lose it: and he that loseth his life for my He that receiueth you, receiueth me: and hee that receiueth mee, Hee that receiueth a Prophet in the name of a Prophet, shall receiue a And whosoeuer shall giue vnto one of these litle ones to drinke a cuppe

Yea, I say vnto you, and more For this is he of whom it is written, Beholde, I send my messenger Verely I say vnto you, among them which are begotten of women, arose And from the time of Iohn Baptist hitherto, the kingdome of heauen For all the Prophetes and the Lawe prophecied vnto Iohn. And if ye will receiue it, this is that Elias, which was to come. He that hath eares to heare, let him heare. But whereunto shall I liken this generation? It is like vnto litle children And say, We haue piped vnto you, and ye haue not daunced, we haue For Iohn came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, He hath a The sonne of man came eating and drinking, and they say, Beholde a Then began he to vpbraide the cities, wherein most of his great workes Woe be to thee, Chorazin: Woe be to thee, Bethsaida: for if ye great But I say to you, It shalbe easier for Tyrus and Sidon at the day of And thou, Capernaum, which art lifted vp vnto heauen, shalt be brought But I say vnto you, that it shall be easier for them of the land of Sodom At that time Iesus answered, and saide, I giue thee thankes, O Father, It is so, O Father, because thy good pleasure was such. All things are giuen vnto me of my Father: and no man knoweth the Come vnto me, all ye that are wearie and laden, and I will ease you. Take my yoke on you, and learne of me that I am meeke and lowly in For my yoke is easie, and my burden light.

and And he stretched foorth his hand toward his disciples, and said, Beholde For whosoeuer shall doe my Fathers will which is in heauen, the same is

The same day went Iesus out of the house, and sate by the sea side. And great multitudes resorted vnto him, so that he went into a ship, and Then he spake many things to them in parables, saying, Behold, a sower And as he sowed, some fell by the way side, and the foules came and And some fell vpon stony grounde, where they had not much earth, and And when the sunne was vp, they were parched, and for lacke of rooting, And some fell among thornes, and the thornes sprong vp, and choked Some againe fel in good ground, and brought forth fruite, one corne an He that hath eares to heare, let him heare. Then the disciples came, and said to him, Why speakest thou to them in And he answered, and said vnto them, Because it is giuen vnto you, to For whosoeuer hath, to him shalbe giuen, and he shall haue abundance: Therefore speake I to them in parables, because they seeing, doe not see: So in them is fulfilled the prophecie of Esaias, which prophecie saieth, For this peoples heart is waxed fat, and their eares are dull of hearing, But blessed are your eyes, for they see: and your eares, for they heare. For verely I say vnto you, that many Prophets, and righteous men haue Heare ye therefore ye parable of ye sower. Whensoeuer any man heareth the woorde of that kingdome, and And hee that receiued seede in the stonie grounde, is he which heareth Yet hath he no roote in himselfe, and dureth but a season: for assoone as And hee that receiued the seede among thornes, is hee that heareth the But he that receiued the seede in the good ground, is he that heareth the Another parable put hee foorth vnto them, saying, The kingdome of But while men slept, there came his enemie, and sowed tares among the And when the blade was sprong vp, and brought forth fruite, then Then came the seruaunts of the housholder, and sayd vnto him, Master, And hee said to them, Some enuious man hath done this. Then the But he saide, Nay, lest while yee goe about to gather the tares, yee Let both growe together vntill the haruest, and in time of haruest I will Another parable he put foorth vnto them, saying, The kingdome of Which in deede is the least of all seedes: but when it is growen, it is the Another parable spake hee to them, The kingdome of heauen is like vnto All these thinges spake Iesus vnto the multitude in parables, and without That it might be fulfilled, which was spoken by the Prophet, saying, I Then sent Iesus the multitude away, and went into the house. At that time Herod the Tetrarche heard of the fame of Iesus, And sayde vnto his seruaunts, This is that Iohn Baptist, hee is risen againe For Herod had taken Iohn, and bounde him, and put him in prison for For Iohn saide vnto him, It is not lawfull for thee to haue her. And when hee woulde haue put him to death, hee feared the multitude, But when Herods birth day was kept, the daughter of Herodias daunced Wherefore he promised with an othe, that he would giue her whatsoeuer And shee being before instructed of her mother, sayde, Giue mee here And the King was sorie: neuerthelesse because of the othe, and them that And sent, and beheaded Iohn in the prison. And he saide, Bring them hither to me. Then came to Iesus the Scribes and Pharises, which were of Hierusalem, Why do thy disciples transgresse the tradition of the Elders? for they wash But he answered and said vnto them, Why doe yee also transgresse the For God hath commanded, saying, Honour thy father and mother: and he But ye say, Whosoeuer shall say to father or mother, By the gift that is Though hee honour not his father, or his mother, shalbe free: thus haue ye O hypocrites, Esaias prophecied well of you, saying, This people draweth neere vnto me with their mouth, and honoureth me But in vaine they worship me, teaching for doctrines, mens precepts. Perceiue ye not yet, that whatsoeuer entreth into the mouth, goeth into But those thinges which proceede out of the mouth, come from the heart, For out of the heart come euil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, These are the things, which defile the man: but to eat with vnwashen And Iesus went thence, and departed into the coastes of Tyrus and Sidon. Verely, verely I say vnto you, Hee that entreth not in by the doore into the But he that goeth in by the doore, is the shepheard of the sheepe. To him the porter openeth, and the sheepe heare his voyce, and he calleth And when hee hath sent foorth his owne sheepe, he goeth before them, And they will not follow a stranger, but they flee from him: for they know This parable spake Iesus vnto them: but they vnderstoode not what things Then sayd Iesus vnto them againe, Verely, verely I say vnto you, I am that All, that euer came before me, are theeues and robbers: but the sheepe did I am that doore: by me if any man enter in, he shall be saued, and shall go The theefe commeth not, but for to steale, and to kill, and to destroy: I I am that good shepheard: that good shepheard giueth his life for his But an hireling, and hee which is not the shepheard, neither the sheepe So the hireling fleeth, because he is an hireling, and careth not for the I am that good shepheard, and knowe mine, and am knowen of mine. As the Father knoweth me, so know I the Father: and I lay downe my Other sheepe I haue also, which are not of this folde: them also must I Therefore doeth my Father loue me, because I lay downe my life, that I No man taketh it from me, but I lay it downe of my selfe: I haue power Then there was a dissension againe among the Iewes for these sayings, And many of them sayd, He hath a deuill, and is mad: why heare ye Other sayd, These are not the wordes of him that hath a deuill: can the And it was at Hierusalem the feast of the Dedication, and it was winter. And Iesus walked in the Temple, in Salomons porche. Then came the Iewes round about him, and sayd vnto him, Howe long Iesus answered them, I tolde you, and ye beleeue not: the workes that I But ye beleeue not: for ye are not of my sheepe, as I sayd vnto you. My sheepe heare my voyce, and I knowe them, and they follow me, And I giue vnto them eternall life, and they shall neuer perish, neither My Father which gaue them me, is greater then all, and none is able to I and my Father are one. Then ye Iewes againe tooke vp stones, to stone him. Iesus answered them, Many good workes haue I shewed you from my The Iewes answered him, saying, For the good worke we stone thee not, Iesus answered them, Is it not written in your Lawe, I sayd, Ye are gods? If hee called them gods, vnto whome the worde of God was giuen, and Say ye of him, whome the Father hath sanctified, and sent into the If I doe not the workes of my Father, beleeue me not. But if I doe, then though ye beleeue not mee, yet beleeue the workes, Againe they went about to take him: but he escaped out of their handes, And went againe beyonde Iordan, into the place where Iohn first And many resorted vnto him, and saide, Iohn did no miracle: but all And many beleeued in him there.

And a certaine man was sicke, named Lazarus of Bethania, the towne of (And it was that Mary which anointed the Lord with oyntment, and wiped Therefore his sisters sent vnto him, saying, Lord, beholde, he whome thou When Iesus heard it, he saide, This sickenes is not vnto death, but for the Nowe Iesus loued Martha and her sister, and Lazarus. And after he had heard that he was sicke, yet abode hee two dayes still in Then after that, said he to his disciples, Let vs goe into Iudea againe. The disciples saide vnto him, Master, the Iewes lately sought to stone Iesus answered, Are there not twelue houres in the day? If a man walke in But if a man walke in the night, hee stumbleth, because there is no light These things spake he, and after, he said vnto them, Our friend Lazarus Then said his disciples, Lord, if he sleepe, he shalbe safe. Howbeit, Iesus spake of his death: but they thought that he had spoken Then saide Iesus vnto them plainely, Lazarus is dead. And I am glad for your sakes, that I was not there, that ye may beleeue: Then saide Thomas (which is called Didymus) vnto his felow disciples, Then came Iesus, and found that he had lien in the graue foure dayes (Nowe Bethania was neere vnto Hierusalem, about fifteene furlongs off.) And many of ye Iewes were come to Martha and Marie to comfort them Then Martha, when shee heard that Iesus was comming, went to meete Then said Martha vnto Iesus, Lord, if thou hadst bene here, my brother But now I know also, that whatsoeuer thou askest of God, God will giue Iesus said vnto her, Thy brother shall rise againe. Martha said vnto him, I know that he shall rise againe in the resurrection Iesus saide vnto her, I am the resurrection and the life: he that beleeueth And whosoeuer liueth, and beleeueth in me, shall neuer die: Beleeuest She said vnto him, Yea, Lord, I beleeue that thou art that Christ that And when she had so saide, she went her way, and called Mary her sister And when she heard it, shee arose quickly, and came vnto him. For Iesus was not yet come into the towne, but was in the place where The Iewes then which were with her in the house, and comforted her, Then when Mary was come where Iesus was, and sawe him, she fell When Iesus therefore saw her weepe, and the Iewes also weepe which And saide, Where haue ye layde him? They said vnto him, Lord, come And Iesus wept. Then saide the Iewes, Beholde, how he loued him. And some of them saide, Coulde not he, which opened the eyes of the Iesus therefore againe groned in himselfe, and came to the graue. And it Iesus saide, Take ye away the stone. Martha the sister of him that was Iesus saide vnto her, Saide I not vnto thee, that if thou diddest beleeue, Then they tooke away the stone from the place where the dead was I knowe that thou hearest me alwayes, but because of the people that As hee had spoken these things, hee cried with a loude voyce, Lazarus, Then he that was dead, came forth, bound hande and foote with bandes, Then many of the Iewes, which came to Mary, and had seene the But some of them went their way to the Pharises, and told them what Then gathered the hie Priests, and the Pharises a councill, and said, What If we let him thus alone, all men will beleeue in him, and the Romanes Then one of them named Caiaphas, which was the hie Priest that same Nor yet doe you consider that it is expedient for vs, that one man die for This spake hee not of himselfe: but being hie Priest that same yere, he And not for that nation onely, but that he shoulde gather together in one Then from that day foorth they consulted together, to put him to death. For the poore alwayes yee haue with you, but me ye shall not haue Then much people of the Iewes knewe that hee was there: and they came, The hie Priestes therefore consulted, that they might put Lazarus to death Because that for his sake many of the Iewes went away, and beleeued in On the morowe a great multitude that were come to the feast, when they Tooke branches of palme trees, and went foorth to meete him, and cried, And Iesus found a yong asse, and sate thereon, as it is written, Feare not, daughter of Sion: behold, thy King commeth sitting on an But his disciples vnderstoode not these thinges at the first: but when The people therefore that was with him, bare witnesse that hee called Therefore mette him the people also, because they heard that he had And the Pharises said among themselues, Perceiue ye howe ye preuaile Nowe there were certaine Greekes among them that came vp to worship And they came to Philippe, which was of Bethsaida in Galile, and Philippe came and tolde Andrew: and againe Andrew and Philippe tolde And Iesus answered them, saying, The houre is come, that the Sonne of Verely, verely I say vnto you, Except the wheate corne fall into the He that loueth his life, shall lose it, and he that hateth his life in this If any man serue me, let him follow me: for where I am, there shall also Now is my soule troubled: and what shall I say? Father, saue me from Father, glorifie thy Name. Then came there a voyce from heauen, saying, Then saide the people that stoode by, and heard, that it was a thunder: Iesus answered, and said, This voyce came not because of me, but for Now is the iudgement of this world: nowe shall the prince of this world And I, if I were lift vp from the earth, will drawe all men vnto me. Nowe this sayd he, signifying what death he should die. The people answered him, We haue heard out of the Law, that that Christ Then Iesus sayd vnto them, Yet a litle while is the light with you: walke While ye haue that light, beleeue in that light, that ye may be the And though he had done so many miracles before them, yet beleeued That the saying of Esaias the Prophete might be fulfilled, that he sayd, Therefore could they not beleeue, because that Esaias saith againe, He hath blinded their eyes, and hardened their heart, that they shoulde These things sayd Esaias when he sawe his glory, and spake of him. Neuertheles, euen among the chiefe rulers, many beleeued in him: but For they loued the prayse of men, more then the prayse of God. And Iesus cryed, and sayd, He that beleeueth in me, beleeueth not in me, And he that seeth me, seeth him that sent me. I am come a light into the world, that whosoeuer beleeueth in me, should And if any man heare my wordes, and beleeue not, I iudge him not: for I He that refuseth me, and receiueth not my wordes, hath one that iudgeth For I haue not spoken of my selfe: but the Father which sent me, hee And I knowe that his commandement is life euerlasting: the thinges

Nowe before the feast of the Passeouer, when Iesus knewe that his houre And when supper was done (and that the deuill had now put in the heart Iesus knowing that the Father had giuen all things into his hands, and that He riseth from supper, and layeth aside his vpper garments, and tooke a After that, hee powred water into a basen, and began to wash the disciples Then came he to Simon Peter, who sayd to him, Lord, doest thou wash Iesus answered and sayd vnto him, What I doe, thou knowest not nowe: Peter said vnto him, Thou shalt neuer wash my feete. Iesus answered him, Simon Peter sayd vnto him, Lord, not my feete onely, but also the hands Iesus sayd to him, He that is washed, needeth not, saue to wash his feete, For hee knewe who should betray him: therefore sayd he, Ye are not all So after he had washed their feete, and had taken his garments, and was Ye call me Master, and Lord, and ye say well: for so am I. If I then your Lord, and Master, haue washed your feete, ye also ought to For I haue giuen you an example, that ye should doe, euen as I haue Verely, verely I say vnto you, The seruant is not greater then his master, If ye know these things, blessed are ye, if ye doe them. I speake not of you all: I know whom I haue chosen: but it is that the From henceforth tell I you before it come, that when it is come to passe, Verely, verely I say vnto you, If I send any, he that receiueth him, When Iesus had sayd these things, he was troubled in the Spirit, and Then the disciples looked one on another, doubting of whom he spake. Nowe there was one of his disciples, which leaned on Iesus bosome, To him beckened therefore Simon Peter, that he should aske who it was He then, as he leaned on Iesus breast, saide vnto him, Lord, who is it? Iesus answered, He it is, to whome I shall giue a soppe, when I haue dipt And after the soppe, Satan entred into him. Then sayd Iesus vnto him, But none of them that were at table, knew, for what cause he spake it For some of them thought because Iudas had the bag, that Iesus had sayd Assoone then as he had receiued the soppe, he went immediately out, When hee was gone out, Iesus sayd, Nowe is the Sonne of man glorified, If God be glorified in him, God shall also glorifie him in himselfe, and Litle children, yet a litle while am I with you: ye shall seeke me, but as I A newe commandement giue I vnto you, that ye loue one another: as I By this shall all men knowe that ye are my disciples, if ye haue loue one Simon Peter said vnto him, Lord, whither goest thou? Iesus answered Peter sayd vnto him, Lord, why can I not follow thee now? I will lay Iesus answered him, Wilt thou lay downe thy life for my sake? Verely,

Let not your heart be troubled: ye beleeue in God, beleeue also in me. In my Fathers house are many dwelling places: if it were not so, I would And if I go to prepare a place for you, I wil come againe, and receiue you And whither I go, ye know, and the way ye knowe. Thomas sayd vnto him, Lord, we know not whither thou goest: how can Iesus sayd vnto him, I am that Way, and that Trueth, and that Life. No If ye had knowen mee, ye should haue knowen my Father also: and from Philippe sayd vnto him, Lord, shewe vs thy Father, and it sufficeth vs. Iesus sayd vnto him, I haue bene so long time with you, and hast thou not Beleeuest thou not, that I am in the Father, and the Father is in me? The Beleeue me, that I am in the Father, and the Father is in me: at the least, Verely, verely I say vnto you, he that beleeueth in me, the workes that I And whatsoeuer ye aske in my Name, that will I doe, that the Father may If ye shall aske any thing in my Name, I will doe it. If ye loue me, keepe my comandements, And I wil pray the Father, and he shall giue you another Comforter, that Euen the Spirit of trueth, whome the world can not receiue, because it I will not leaue you fatherles: but I will come to you. Yet a litle while, and the world shall see me no more, but ye shall see At that day shall ye knowe that I am in my Father, and you in me, and I He that hath my commandements, and keepeth them, is he that loueth Iudas sayd vnto him (not Iscariot) Lord, what is the cause that thou wilt Iesus answered, and sayd vnto him, If any man loue me, he will keepe He that loueth me not, keepeth not my wordes, and the worde which ye These things haue I spoken vnto you, being present with you. But the Comforter, which is the holy Ghost, whom the Father wil send in Peace I leaue with you: my peace I giue vnto you: not as the worlde Ye haue heard howe I saide vnto you, I goe away, and will come vnto And nowe haue I spoken vnto you, before it come, that when it is come Hereafter will I not speake many things vnto you: for the prince of this But it is that the world may knowe that I loue my Father: and as the

I Am that true vine, and my Father is that husband man. Euery branch that beareth not fruite in me, he taketh away: and euery one Nowe are ye cleane through the worde, which I haue spoken vnto you. Abide in me, and I in you: as the branche cannot beare fruite of it selfe, I am that vine: ye are the branches: he that abideth in me, and I in him, the If a man abide not in me, he is cast forth as a branche, and withereth: and If ye abide in me, and my wordes abide in you, aske what ye wil, and it Herein is my Father glorified, that ye beare much fruite, and be made my As the father hath loued me, so haue I loued you: continue in that my If ye shall keepe my commandements, ye shall abide in my loue, as I These things haue I spoken vnto you, that my ioy might remaine in you, This is my commandement, that ye loue one another, as I haue loued Greater loue then this hath no man, when any man bestoweth his life for Ye are my friendes, if ye doe whatsoeuer I commaund you. Henceforth call I you not seruants: for the seruant knoweth not what his Ye haue not chosen me, but I haue chosen you, and ordeined you, that ye These things commaund I you, that ye loue one another. If the worlde hate you, ye knowe that it hated me before you. If ye were of the worlde, the world woulde loue his owne: but because Remember the word that I said vnto you, The seruant is not greater then But all these things will they doe vnto you for my Names sake, because If I had not come and spoken vnto them, they shoulde not haue had He that hateth me, hateth my Father also. If I had not done workes among them which none other man did, they But it is that the worde might be fulfilled, that is written in their Lawe, But when that Comforter shall come, whom I will send vnto you from And ye shall witnesse also, because ye haue bene with me from the

These thinges haue I saide vnto you, that ye should not be offended. They shall excommunicate you: yea, the time shall come, that whosoeuer And these things will they doe vnto you, because they haue not knowen But these things haue I tolde you, that when the houre shall come, ye But now I go my way to him that sent me, and none of you asketh me, But because I haue saide these thinges vnto you, your hearts are full of Yet I tell you the trueth, It is expedient for you that I goe away: for if I And when he is come, he will reproue the worlde of sinne, and of Of sinne, because they beleeued not in me: Of righteousnesse, because I goe to my Father, and ye shall see me no Of iudgement, because the prince of this world is iudged. I haue yet many things to say vnto you, but ye cannot beare them nowe. Howbeit, when he is come which is the Spirit of trueth, he will leade you He shall glorifie me: for he shall receiue of mine, and shall shewe it vnto All thinges that the Father hath, are mine: therefore said I, that he shall A litle while, and ye shall not see me: and againe a litle while, and ye Then said some of his disciples among them selues, What is this that he They said therefore, What is this that he saith, A litle while? we know Now Iesus knew that they would aske him, and said vnto them, Doe ye Verely, verely I say vnto you, that ye shall weepe and lament, and the A woman when she traueileth, hath sorowe, because her houre is come: And ye nowe therefore are in sorowe: but I will see you againe, and your And in that day shall ye aske me nothing. Verely, verely I say vnto you, Hitherto haue ye asked nothing in my Name: aske, and ye shall receiue, These things haue I spoken vnto you in parables: but the time will come, At that day shall ye aske in my Name, and I say not vnto you, that I will For the Father himselfe loueth you, because ye haue loued me, and haue I am come out from the Father, and came into the worlde: againe I leaue His disciples saide vnto him, Loe, nowe speakest thou plainely, and thou Nowe knowe wee that thou knowest all things, and needest not that any Iesus answered them, Doe you beleeue nowe? Beholde, the houre commeth, and is already come, that ye shalbe These thinges haue I spoken vnto you, that in me ye might haue peace:

These things spake Iesus, and lift vp his eyes to heauen, and saide, Father, As thou hast giuen him power ouer all flesh, that he shoulde giue eternall And this is life eternall, that they knowe thee to be the onely very God, I haue glorified thee on the earth: I haue finished the worke which thou And nowe glorifie me, thou Father, with thine owne selfe, with the glorie I haue declared thy Name vnto the men which thou gauest me out of the Nowe they knowe that all things whatsoeuer thou hast giuen me, are of For I haue giuen vnto them the wordes which thou gauest me, and they I pray for them: I pray not for the worlde, but for them which thou hast And al mine are thine, and thine are mine, and I am glorified in them. And nowe am I no more in the world, but these are in the worlde, and I While I was with them in the worlde, I kept them in thy Name: those that And now come I to thee, and these things speake I in the worlde, that I haue giuen them thy word, and the world hath hated them, because I pray not that thou shouldest take them out of the world, but that thou They are not of the worlde, as I am not of the world. Sanctifie them with thy trueth: thy word is trueth. As thou diddest send me into the world, so haue I sent them into the And for their sakes sanctifie I my selfe, that they also may bee sanctified I praie not for these alone, but for them also which shall beleeue in mee, That they all may bee one, as thou, O Father, art in me, and I in thee: And the glory that thou gauest me, I haue giuen them, that they may be I in them, and thou in mee, that they may be made perfect in one, and Father, I will that they which thou hast giuen me, be with me euen where O righteous Father, the worlde also hath not knowen thee, but I haue And I haue declared vnto the thy Name, and will declare it, that the loue

Then went out the other disciple Then saide the maide that kept the doore, vnto Peter, Art not thou also And the seruants and officers stoode there, which had made a fire of (The hie Priest then asked Iesus of his disciples, and of his doctrine. Then led they Iesus from Caiaphas into the common hall. Nowe it was Pilate then went out vnto them, and said, What accusation bring yee They answered, and saide vnto him, If hee were not an euill doer, we Then sayde Pilate vnto them, Take yee him, and iudge him after your It was that the worde of Iesus might be fulfilled which he spake, So Pilate entred into the common hall againe, and called Iesus, and Iesus answered him, Saiest thou that of thy selfe, or did other tell it thee Pilate answered, Am I a Iewe? Thine owne nation, and the hie Priestes Iesus answered, My kingdome is not of this worlde: if my kingdome Pilate then said vnto him, Art thou a King then? Iesus answered, Thou Pilate said vnto him, What is trueth? And when he had saide that, hee But you haue a custome, that I shoulde deliuer you one loose at the Then cried they all againe, saying, Not him, but Barabbas: nowe this

Paul a seruant of Iesus Christ called to be an Apostle, put apart to preache (Which he had promised afore by his Prophetes in the holy Scriptures) Concerning his Sonne Iesus Christ our Lord (which was made of the And declared mightily to be the Sonne of God, touching the Spirit of By whom we haue receiued grace and Apostleship (that obedience might Among whom ye be also the called of Iesus Christ: To all you that be at Rome beloued of God, called to be Saints: Grace be First I thanke my God through Iesus Christ for you all, because your faith For God is my witnesse (whom I serue in my spirit in the Gospel of his Alwayes in my prayers, beseeching that by some meanes, one time or For I long to see you, that I might bestowe among you some spirituall That is, that I might be comforted together with you, through our mutuall Now my brethren, I would that ye should not be ignorant, how that I I am detter both to the Grecians, and to the Barbarians, both to the wise Therefore, as much as in me is, I am readie to preach ye Gospel to you For I am not ashamed of the Gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God For by it the righteousnesse of God is reueiled from faith to faith: as it is For the wrath of God is reueiled from heauen against all vngodlinesse, Forasmuch as that, which may be knowe of God, is manifest in them: for For the inuisible things of him, that is, his eternal power and Godhead, Because that when they knewe God, they glorified him not as God, When they professed themselues to be wise, they became fooles. Therefore thou art inexcusable, O man, whosoeuer thou art that But we know that the iudgement of God is according to trueth, against And thinkest thou this, O thou man, that condemnest them which doe Or despisest thou the riches of his bountifulnesse, and patience, and long But thou, after thine hardnesse, and heart that canot repent, heapest vp as Who wil reward euery man according to his woorkes: That is, to them which through patience in well doing, seeke glorie, and But vnto them that are contentious and disobey the trueth, and obey Tribulation and anguish shalbe vpon the soule of euery man that doeth But to euery man that doeth good, shalbe glory, and honour, and peace: For there is no respect of persons with God. What is then the preferment of the Iewe? or what is the profite of Much euery maner of way: for chiefly, because vnto them were of credite For what, though some did not beleeue? shall their vnbeliefe make the God forbid: yea, let God be true, and euery man a lyar, as it is written, Now if our vnrighteousnes comend the righteousnes of God, what shall God forbid: els how shall God iudge ye world? For if the veritie of God hath more abounded through my lye vnto his And (as we are blamed, and as some affirme, that we say) why doe we not What then? are we more excellent? No, in no wise: for we haue alreadie As it is written, There is none righteous, no not one. There is none that vnderstandeth: there is none that seeketh God. They haue all gone out of the way: they haue bene made altogether Their throte is an open sepulchre: they haue vsed their tongues to deceit: Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitternesse. Their feete are swift to shead blood. Destruction and calamity are in their waies, And ye way of peace they haue not knowen. The feare of God is not before their eies. Now we know that whatsoeuer ye Lawe saieth, it saieth it to them which Therefore by the woorkes of the Lawe shall no flesh be iustified in his But nowe is the righteousnesse, of God made manifest without the To wit, the righteousnesse of God by the faith of Iesus Christ, vnto all, For there is no difference: for all haue sinned, and are depriued of the And are iustified freely by his grace, through the redemption that is in Whom God hath set forth to be a reconciliation through faith in his Through the patience of God, to shewe at this time his righteousnesse, Where is then the reioycing? It is excluded. By what Lawe? of woorkes? Therefore we conclude, that a man is iustified by faith, without the God, is he the God of the Iewes onely, and not of the Gentiles also? Yes, For it is one God, who shall iustifie circumcision of faith, and Doe we then make the Lawe of none effect through faith? God forbid:

What shall we say then? Shall we continue still in sinne, that grace may Howe shall we, that are dead to sinne, liue yet therein? In iourneying I was often, in perils of waters, in perils of robbers, in To God, I say, only wise, be praise through Iesus Christ for euer. Amen. If I must needes reioyce, I will reioyce of mine infirmities. That, according as it is written, Hee that reioyceth, let him reioyce in the And they that vse this worlde, as though they vsed it not: for the fashion Whether therefore ye eate, or drinke, or whatsoeuer ye doe, doe all to the For if we would iudge our selues, we should not be iudged. But desire you the best giftes, and I will yet shewe you a more excellent For ye may all prophecie one by one, that all may learne, and all may By your reioycing which I haue in Christ Iesus our Lord, I die dayly. The vnmaried careth for the things Giue none offence, neither to the Iewes, nor to the Grecians, nor to the But when we are iudged, we are chastened of the Lord, because we And the spirits of the Prophets are subiect to the Prophets. If I haue fought with beastes at Ephesus after ye maner of men, what In Damascus the gouernour of the people vnder King Aretas, layde But hee that is maried, careth for the things of the world, how he may Euen as I please all men in all things, not seeking mine owne profite, but Wherefore, my brethren, when ye come together to eate, tary one for For God is not the author of confusion, but of peace, as we see in all ye Be not deceiued: euill speakings corrupt good maners. But at a window was I let downe in a basket through the wall, and There is difference also betweene a virgine and a wife: the vnmaried And if any man be hungry, let him eate at home, that ye come not Let your women keepe silence in the Churches: for it is not permitted Awake to liue righteously, and sinne not: for some haue not ye And this I speake for your owne commoditie, not to tangle you in a And if they will learne any thing, let them aske their husbands at home: But some man will say, Howe are the dead raised vp? and with what But if any man thinke that it is vncomely for his virgine, if shee passe Came the worde of God out from you? either came it vnto you onely? O foole, that which thou sowest, is not quickened, except it die. Neuerthelesse, hee that standeth firme in his heart, that hee hath no If any man thinke him selfe to be a Prophet, or spirituall, let him And that which thou sowest, thou sowest not that body that shalbe, but So then hee that giueth her to mariage, doeth well, but he that giueth her And if any man be ignorant, let him be ignorant. But God giueth it a body at his pleasure, euen to euery seede his owne The wife is bounde by the Lawe, as long as her husband liueth: but if her Wherefore, brethren, couet to prophecie, and forbid not to speake All flesh is not the same flesh, but there is one flesh of men, and another But shee is more blessed, if she so abide, in my iudgement: and I thinke Let all things be done honestly, and by order. There are also heauenly bodies, and earthly bodies: but the glorie of the There is another glorie of the sunne, and another glorie of the moone, So also is the resurrection of the dead. The bodie is sowen in corruption, It is sowen in dishonour, and is raysed in glory: it is sowen in It is sowen a naturall body, and is raysed a spirituall body: there is a As it is also written, The first man Adam was made a liuing soule: and Howbeit that was not first which is spirituall: but that which is naturall, The first man is of the earth, earthly: the second man is the Lord from As is the earthly, such are they that are earthly: and as is the heauenly, And as we haue borne the image of the earthly, so shall we beare the This say I, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherite the kingdome of Behold, I shewe you a secret thing, We shall not all sleepe, but we shall In a moment, in the twinckling of an eye at the last trumpet: for the For this corruptible must put on incorruption: and this mortall must put So when this corruptible hath put on incorruption, and this mortall hath O death where is thy sting? O graue where is thy victorie? The sting of death is sinne: and ye strength of sinne is the Lawe. But thankes be vnto God, which hath giuen vs victorie through our Lord Therefore my beloued brethren, be ye stedfast, vnmoueable, aboundant

Pavl an Apostle (not of men, neither by man, but by Iesus Christ, and God And all the brethren which are with me, vnto the Churches of Galatia: Grace be with you, and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Which gaue himself for our sinnes, that he might deliuer vs from this To whom be glory for euer and euer, Amen. I marueile that ye are so soone remoued away vnto another Gospel, from Which is not another Gospel, saue that there be some which trouble you, But though that we, or an Angel from heauen preach vnto you otherwise, As we sayd before, so say I now againe, If any man preach vnto you For nowe preach I mans doctrine, or Gods? or go I about to please men? Now I certifie you, brethren, that ye Gospel which was preached of me, For neither receiued I it of man, neither was I taught it, but by the For ye haue heard of my conuersation in time past, in the Iewish And profited in the Iewish religion aboue many of my companions of But when it pleased God (which had separated me from my mothers To reueile his Sonne in me, that I should preach him among the Gentiles, Neither came I againe to Hierusalem to them which were Apostles Then after three yeeres I came againe to Hierusalem to visite Peter, and And none other of the Apostles sawe I, saue Iames the Lords brother. Nowe the things which I write vnto you, beholde, I witnes before God, After that, I went into the coastes of Syria and Cilicia: for I was But they had heard onely some say, Hee which persecuted vs in time And they glorified God for me.

I am crucified with Christ, but I liue, yet not I any more, but Christ liueth I doe not abrogate the grace of God: for if righteousnes be by the Lawe,

O foolish Galatians, who hath bewitched you, that ye should not obey the This only would I learne of you, Receiued ye the Spirit by the workes of Are ye so foolish, that after ye haue begun in the Spirit, ye would now be Haue ye suffered so many things in vaine? if so be it be euen in vaine. He therefore that ministreth to you the Spirit, and worketh miracles Yea rather as Abraham beleeued God, and it was imputed to him for Knowe ye therefore, that they which are of faith, the same are the children For the Scripture foreseeing, that God would iustifie the Gentiles through So then they which be of faith, are blessed with faithfull Abraham. For as many as are of the workes of the Lawe, are vnder the curse: for it And that no man is iustified by the Law in the sight of God, it is euident: And the Lawe is not of faith: but the man that shall doe those things, Christ hath redeemed vs from the curse of the Lawe, made a curse for vs, That the blessing of Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Christ Brethren, I speake as men do: though it be but a mans couenant, when it Nowe to Abraham and his seede were the promises made. Hee saith not, And this I say, that the couenant that was confirmed afore of God in For if the inheritance be of the Lawe, it is no more by the promise, but Wherefore then serueth the Law? It was added because of the Nowe a Mediatour is not a Mediatour of one: but God is one. Is the Lawe then against the promises of God? God forbid: For if there But the Scripture hath concluded all vnder sinne, that the promise by the But before faith came, we were kept vnder the Law, as vnder a garison, Wherefore the Lawe was our scholemaster to bring vs to Christ, that we But after that faith is come, we are no longer vnder a scholemaster. For ye are al the sonnes of God by faith, in Christ Iesus. For all ye that are baptized into Christ, haue put on Christ. There is neither Iewe nor Grecian: there is neither bonde nor free: there And if ye be Christes, then are ye Abrahams seede, and heires by

Then I say, that the heire as long as hee is a childe, differeth nothing from But is vnder tutours and gouernours, vntil the time appointed of the Euen so, we when wee were children, were in bondage vnder the But when the fulnesse of time was come, God sent forth his Sonne made That hee might redeeme them which were vnder the Law, that we might And because ye are sonnes, God hath sent foorth the Spirit of his Sonne Wherefore, thou art no more a seruant, but a sonne: now if thou be a sone, But euen then, when ye knewe not God, yee did seruice vnto them, which But now seeing ye knowe God, yea, rather are knowen of God, howe Ye obserue dayes, and moneths, and times and yeeres. I am in feare of you, lest I haue bestowed on you labour in vaine. Be ye as I (for I am euen as you) brethren, I beseech you: ye haue not And ye know, how through infirmitie of the flesh, I preached ye Gospel And the trial of me which was in my flesh, ye despised not, neither What was then your felicitie? for I beare you recorde, that if it had bene Am I therefore become your enemie, because I tell you the trueth? They are ielous ouer you amisse: yea, they woulde exclude you, that ye But it is a good thing to loue earnestly alwayes in a good thing, and not My litle children, of whome I trauaile in birth againe, vntill Christ be And I would I were with you nowe, that I might change my voyce: for I Tell me, ye that will be vnder the Law, doe ye not heare the Lawe? For it is written, that Abraham had two sonnes, one by a seruant, and one But he which was of the seruant, was borne after the flesh: and he which By the which things another thing is meant: for these mothers are the (For Agar or Sina is a mountaine in Arabia, and it answereth to But Hierusalem, which is aboue, is free: which is the mother of vs all. For it is written, Reioyce thou barren that bearest no children: breake Therefore, brethren, wee are after the maner of Isaac, children of the But as then hee that was borne after the flesh, persecuted him that was But what sayth the Scripture? Put out the seruant and her sonne: for the Then brethren, we are not children of the seruant, but of the free woman.

Stand fast therefore in the libertie wherewith Christ hath made vs free, Beholde, I Paul say vnto you, that if yee be circumcised, Christ shall For I testifie againe to euery man, which is circumcised, that he is bound Ye are abolished from Christ: whosoeuer are iustified by the Law, ye are For we through the Spirit waite for the hope of righteousnes through faith. For in Iesus Christ neither circumcision auaileth any thing, neither Ye did runne well: who did let you, that ye did not obey the trueth? It is not the perswasion of him that calleth you. A litle leauen doeth leauen the whole lumpe. I haue trust in you through the Lord, that ye will be none otherwise And brethren, if I yet preach circumcision, why doe I yet suffer Would to God they were euen cut off, which doe disquiet you. For brethren, ye haue bene called vnto libertie: onely vse not your For all the Lawe is fulfilled in one worde, which is this, Thou shalt loue If ye bite and deuoure one another, take heede least ye be consumed one Then I say, Walke in the Spirit, and ye shall not fulfill the lustes of the For the flesh lusteth against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh: And if ye be led by the Spirit, ye are not vnder the Lawe. Moreouer the workes of the flesh are manifest, which are adulterie, Idolatrie, witchcraft, hatred, debate, emulations, wrath, contentions, Enuie, murthers, drunkennesse, gluttonie, and such like, whereof I tell But the fruite of the Spirit is loue, ioye, peace, long suffering, gentlenes, Meekenesse, temperancie: against such there is no lawe. For they that are Christes, haue crucified the flesh with the affections If we liue in the Spirit, let vs also walke in the Spirit. Let vs not be desirous of vaine glorie, prouoking one another, enuying

Brethren, if a man be suddenly taken in any offence, ye which are Beare ye one anothers burden, and so fulfill the Lawe of Christ. For if any man seeme to himselfe, that he is somewhat, when he is But let euery man prooue his owne worke: and then shall he haue For euery man shall beare his owne burden. Let him that is taught in the worde, make him that hath taught him, Be not deceiued: God is not mocked: for whatsoeuer a man soweth, that For hee that soweth to his flesh, shall of the flesh reape corruption: but Let vs not therefore be weary of well doing: for in due season we shall While we haue therefore time, let vs doe good vnto all men, but Ye see how large a letter I haue written vnto you with mine owne hand. As many as desire to make a faire shewe in the flesh, they constraine For they themselues which are circumcised keepe not the law, but desire But God forbid that I should reioyce, but in ye crosse of our Lord Iesus For in Christ Iesus neither circumcision auaileth any thing, nor And as many as walke according to this rule, peace shalbe vpon them, From henceforth let no man put me to busines: for I beare in my body Brethren, the grace of our Lord Iesus Christ be with your spirit, Amen.

Pavl an Apostle of Jesvs Christ by the will of God, to the Saints, which Grace be with you, and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Blessed be God, and the Father of our Lord Iesus Christ, which hath As hee hath chosen vs in him, before the foundation of the worlde, that Who hath predestinate vs, to be adopted through Iesus Christ in him selfe, To the prayse of the glory of his grace, wherewith he hath made vs freely By whom we haue redemption through his blood, euen the forgiuenes of Whereby he hath bene aboundant toward vs in all wisedome and And hath opened vnto vs the mysterie of his will according to his good That in the dispensation of the fulnesse of the times, he might gather In whom also we are chosen when we were predestinate according to ye That we, which first trusted in Christ, should be vnto the praise of his In whom also ye haue trusted, after that ye heard the worde of trueth, Which is the earnest of our inheritance, for the redemption of that Therefore also after that I heard of the faith, which ye haue in the Lord I cease not to giue thankes for you, making mention of you in my That the God of our Lord Iesus Christ, that Father of glory, might giue That the eyes of your vnderstanding may be lightened, that ye may And what is the exceeding greatnesse of his power toward vs, which Which he wrought in Christ, when he raised him from the dead, and set Farre aboue al principalitie, and power, and might, and domination, and And hath made all things subiect vnder his feete, and hath giuen him Which is his body, euen the fulnesse of him that filleth all in all things.

And you hath he quickened, that were dead in trespasses and sinnes, Wherein, in times past ye walked, according to the course of this world, Among whom we also had our conuersation in time past, in the lustes of But God which is rich in mercie, through his great loue wherewith he Euen when we were dead by sinnes, hath quickened vs together in Christ, And hath raysed vs vp together, and made vs sit together in the heauenly That he might shewe in the ages to come the exceeding riches of his For by grace are ye saued through faith, and that not of your selues: it is Not of workes, least any man should boast himselfe. For we are his workemanship created in Christ Iesus vnto good workes, Wherefore remember that ye being in time past Gentiles in the flesh, and That ye were, I say, at that time without Christ, and were alients from the But nowe in Christ Iesus, ye which once were farre off, are made neere For he is our peace, which hath made of both one, and hath broken the In abrogating through his flesh the hatred, that is, the Lawe of And that he might reconcile both vnto God in one body by his crosse, And came, and preached peace to you which were afarre off, and to them For through him we both haue an entrance vnto the Father by one Spirit. Nowe therefore ye are no more strangers and forreiners: but citizens And are built vpon the foundation of the Apostles and Prophets, Iesus In whom all the building coupled together, groweth vnto an holy Temple In whom ye also are built together to be the habitation of God by the

For this cause, I Paul am the prisoner of Iesus Christ for you Gentiles, If ye haue heard of the dispensation of the grace of God, which is giuen That is, that God by reuelation hath shewed this mysterie vnto me (as I Whereby when ye reade, ye may knowe mine vnderstanding in the Which in other ages was not opened vnto the sonnes of men, as it is nowe That the Gentiles should be inheriters also, and of the same body, and Whereof I am made a minister by the gift of the grace of God giuen vnto Euen vnto me the least of all Saints is this grace giuen, that I should And to make cleare vnto all men what the fellowship of the mysterie is, To the intent, that nowe vnto principalities and powers in heauenly According to the eternall purpose, which he wrought in Christ Iesus our By whom we haue boldenes and entrance with confidence, by faith in Wherefore I desire that ye faint not at my tribulations for your sakes, For this cause I bowe my knees vnto the Father of our Lord Iesus Christ, (Of whom is named the whole familie in heauen and in earth) That he might graunt you according to the riches of his glorie, that ye That Christ may dwell in your heartes by faith: That ye, being rooted and grounded in loue, may be able to comprehend And to knowe the loue of Christ, which passeth knowledge, that ye may Vnto him therefore that is able to do exceeding aboundantly aboue all Be praise in the Church by Christ Iesus, throughout all generations for

I therefore, being prisoner in the Lord, praie you that yee walke worthie With all humblenesse of minde, and meekenesse, with long suffering, Endeuouring to keepe the vnitie of the Spirit in the bond of peace. There is one body, and one Spirit, euen as yee are called in one hope of There is one Lord, one Faith, one Baptisme, One God and Father of all, which is aboue all, and through all, and in you But vnto euery one of vs is giuen grace, according to the measure of the Wherfore he saith, Whe he asceded vp on hie, he led captiuity captiue, (Nowe, in that hee ascended, what is it but that he had also descended first Hee that descended, is euen the same that ascended, farre aboue all Hee therefore gaue some to be Apostles, and some Prophets, and some For the repairing of the Saintes, for the woorke of the ministerie, and for Till we all meete together (in the vnitie of faith and that acknowledging That we henceforth be no more children, wauering and caried about with But let vs folowe the truth in loue, and in all things, grow vp into him, By whome al the body being coupled and knit together by euery ioynt, This I say therefore and testifie in the Lord, that yee hencefoorth walke Hauing their vnderstanding darkened, and being strangers from the life Which being past feeling, haue giuen themselues vnto wantonnesse, to But yee haue not so learned Christ, If so be yee haue heard him, and haue bene taught by him, as the trueth That is, that yee cast off, concerning the conuersation in time past, that And be renued in the spirit of your minde, And put on ye new man, which after God is created vnto righteousnes, Wherefore cast off lying, and speake euery man truth vnto his Bee angrie, but sinne not: let not the sunne goe downe vpon your wrath, Neither giue place to the deuill. Let him that stole, steale no more: but let him rather labour, and worke Let no corrupt comunication proceed out of your mouths: but that which And grieue not the holy Spirit of God, by whom ye are sealed vnto ye Let all bitternesse, and anger, and wrath, crying, and euill speaking be Be ye courteous one to another, and tender hearted, freely forgiuing one

Bee yee therefore followers of God, as deare children, And walke in loue, euen as Christ hath loued vs, and hath giuen himselfe But fornication, and all vncleannesse, or couetousnesse, let it not be once Neither filthinesse, neither foolish talking, neither iesting, which are For this ye know, that no whoremonger, neither vncleane person, nor Let no man deceiue you with vaine wordes: for, for such thinges commeth Be not therefore companions with them. For ye were once darkenesse, but are nowe light in the Lord: walke as (For the fruit of the Spirit is in al goodnes, and righteousnes, and trueth) Approuing that which is pleasing to the Lord. And haue no fellowship with ye vnfruitfull works of darknes, but euen For it is shame euen to speake of the things which are done of them in But all thinges when they are reproued of the light, are manifest: for it is Wherefore hee sayeth, Awake thou that sleepest, and stande vp from the Take heede therefore that yee walke circumspectly, not as fooles, but as Redeeming ye season: for ye daies are euill. Wherefore, be ye not vnwise, but vnderstand what the will of the Lord And be not drunke with wine, wherein is excesse: but be fulfilled with Speaking vnto your selues in psalmes, and hymnes, and spirituall songs, Giuing thankes alwaies for all thinges vnto God euen the Father, in the Submitting your selues one to another in the feare of God. Wiues, submit your selues vnto your husbands, as vnto the Lord. For the husband is the wiues head, euen as Christ is the head of the Therfore as the Church is in subiection to Christ, euen so let the wiues Husbands, loue your wiues, euen as Christ loued the Church, and gaue That hee might sanctifie it, and clense it by the washing of water through That hee might make it vnto him selfe a glorious Church, not hauing So ought men to loue their wiues, as their owne bodies: he that loueth For no man euer yet hated his owne flesh, but nourisheth and cherisheth For we are members of his bodie, of his flesh, and of his bones. For this cause shall a man leaue father and mother, and shall cleaue to This is a great secrete, but I speake concerning Christ, and concerning Therefore euery one of you, doe ye so: let euery one loue his wife, euen

Children, obey your parents in the Lord: for this is right. Honour thy father and mother (which is the first commandement with That it may be well with thee, and that thou mayst liue long on earth. Some mens sinnes are open before hand, and goe before vnto iudgement: But the seruant of ye Lord must not striue, but must be gentle toward all Brethren, pray for vs. Likewise also the good woorkes are manifest before hande, and they that Instructing them with meekenesse that are contrary minded, prouing if Greete all the brethren with an holy kisse. The first Epistle

In all things shewe thy selfe an ensample of good woorkes with vncorrupt And with the wholesome woorde, which can not be condemned, that hee Let seruants be subiect to their masters, and please them in al things, not Neither pickers, but that they shew al good faithfulnesse, that they may For that grace of God, that bringeth saluation vnto all men, hath And teacheth vs that we should denie vngodlinesse and worldly lusts, Looking for that blessed hope, and appearing of that glorie of that Who gaue him selfe for vs, that hee might redeeme vs from all iniquitie, These things speake, and exhort, and conuince with all authoritie. Pvt them in remembrance that they bee subiect to the Principalities and That they speake euill of no man, that they be no fighters, but soft, For wee our selues also were in times past vnwise, disobedient, deceiued, But when that bountifulnesse and that loue of God our Sauiour toward Not by the woorkes of righteousnesse, which we had done, but according Which he shed on vs aboundantly, through Iesus Christ our Sauiour, That we, being iustified by his grace, should be made heires according to This is a true saying, and these thinges I will thou shouldest affirme, that But stay foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and Reiect him that is an heretike, after once or twise admonition, Knowing that hee that is such, is peruerted, and sinneth, being damned When I shall send Artemas vnto thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come to Bring Zenas the expounder of the Lawe, and Apollos on their iourney And let ours also learne to shewe foorth good woorkes for necessary All that are with mee, salute thee. Greete them that loue vs in the faith.

Paul a prisoner of Iesus Christ, and our brother Timotheus, vnto Philemon And to our deare sister Apphia, and to Archippus our fellowe souldier, Grace be with you, and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord I giue thanks to my God, making mention alwaies of thee in my praiers, (When I heare of thy loue and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord That the fellowship of thy faith may bee made effectuall, and that For we haue great ioy and consolation in thy loue, because by thee, Wherefore, though I bee very bolde in Christ to commaund thee that Yet for loues sake I rather beseeche thee, though I be as I am, euen Paul I beseeche thee for my sonne Onesimus, whome I haue begotten in my Which in times past was to thee vnprofitable, but nowe profitable both to Whome I haue sent againe: thou therefore receiue him, that is mine Whom I woulde haue reteined with mee, that in thy steade he might haue But without thy minde woulde I doe nothing, that thy benefite should not It may be that he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest Not now as a seruant, but aboue a seruant, euen as a brother beloued, If therefore thou count our thinges common, receiue him as my selfe. If he hath hurt thee, or oweth thee ought, that put on mine accounts. I Paul haue written this with mine owne hande: I will recompense it, Yea, brother, let mee obteine this pleasure of thee in the Lord: comfort Trusting in thine obedience, I wrote vnto thee, knowing that thou wilt do Moreouer also prepare mee lodging: for I trust through your prayers I There salute thee Epaphras my felowe prisoner in Christ Iesus, Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas and Luke, my felowe helpers. The grace of our Lord Iesus Christ be with your spirit, Amen. Written
